subject: RE: [junit] Eclipse test runner. was: ClasspathWalker (even better)
msgSnippet: Hi, ... How do you run all tests ? Is this a feature with dependent projects? What I use mostly to run tests is: In the Package Explorer view select a test
messageBody:
Hi,

> First, you stepped into my pet peeve w/ Eclipse. Run the "all
> tests" on one
> project and it runs all the tests on dependent projects. I
> believe it just
> walks the classpath not the project path. It doesn't know the
> difference.

How do you run "all tests"? Is this a feature with dependent projects?

What I use mostly to run tests is: In the "Package Explorer" view
select a test class (or a package) and then choose Run/Run as.../Junit test
and it runs the single test class or all test classes found in the selected
package.

Bernd
